questions_and_answers.subject: ComfyUI_GMIC
questions_and_answers.question: How is G'MIC a part of ComfyUI?
questions_and_answers.answer: G'MIC in ComfyUI is a custom node that provides image-processing features, including effects, filtering, geometric manipulation, image data, and color.

questions_and_answers.subject: ComfyUI_GMIC
questions_and_answers.question: What makes G'MIC friendly for users?
questions_and_answers.answer: G'MIC in ComfyUI is designed to be user-friendly for both beginners and power users with its ongoing documented workflows.

questions_and_answers.subject: ComfyUI_GMIC
questions_and_answers.question: What is the command to install the G'MIC custom node?
questions_and_answers.answer: You can install the G'MIC custom node by cloning the repository with the command `git clone https://github.com/gemell1/ComfyUI_GMIC` or by copying the `comfy_gmic.py` file to your custom nodes folder.

questions_and_answers.subject: ComfyUI_GMIC
questions_and_answers.question: What is required to use the G'MIC custom node?
questions_and_answers.answer: To use the G'MIC custom node, you need to download the G'MIC Command-line interface (CLI) and G'MIC-Qt stand-alone interface, put the executable path in your PATH, and drag the provided workflow to ComfyUI.

questions_and_answers.subject: ComfyUI_GMIC
questions_and_answers.question: When was the first upload of the G'MIC custom node for ComfyUI?
questions_and_answers.answer: The first upload of the G'MIC custom node for ComfyUI was in November.

questions_and_answers.subject: ComfyUI_GMIC
questions_and_answers.question: What platforms does the G'MIC custom node support?
questions_and_answers.answer: The G'MIC custom node supports better cross-platform functionality as of February.

questions_and_answers.subject: ComfyUI_GMIC
questions_and_answers.question: Is there a breaking change to be aware of in March?
questions_and_answers.answer: Yes, in March there were breaking changes, and it is recommended to recreate your workflow.

questions_and_answers.subject: ComfyUI_GMIC
questions_and_answers.question: What is the version of G'MIC-Qt and CLI used in the testing?
questions_and_answers.answer: The version of G'MIC-Qt and CLI used in the testing is 3.3.4.

questions_and_answers.subject: ComfyUI_GMIC
questions_and_answers.question: What version of ComfyUI is G'MIC custom node tested on?
questions_and_answers.answer: The G'MIC custom node is tested on ComfyUI version [March 09](https://github.com/comfyanonymous/ComfyUI/tree/a9ee9589b72aa0e2931f1c0705524c56adaee26d).

questions_and_answers.subject: ComfyUI_GMIC
questions_and_answers.question: Where can I find more ComfyUI custom nodes for image processing?
questions_and_answers.answer: You can find more ComfyUI custom nodes for image processing by visiting the [link](https://github.com/gemell1/ComfyUI_GMIC/wiki).
